lexUnit.name: drag.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: pull along forcefully, roughly, or with difficulty

sentence.text: We dragged the man free and Warren drove the car at the dogs to box them in the alleyway so they could not escape .
When he came round , they dragged him outside and flung him in his night-clothes , into a car and handcuffed him .
The crab-like hand reached him , closed around his belt , and began to drag him relentlessly clear .
In one shop I virtually had to drag a sales assistant away from his pressing chat with a colleague to help me .
Round and round they staggered like the end of some ghastly marathon , Luke dragging Maldita upright and along by her headcollar , supporting her with his body , Perdita propping up her other side .
Meg dragged her chair close and put her arms around the older woman .
There was a little struggle and Osman half dragged himself free .
Cornelius dragged his suitcase across the deserted concourse of the grand Victorian station .
` I saw state policemen drag strikers across the road and make them kneel in the ditch there while they held shotguns in their backs .
Working dogs -- even those dragging sledges across the snow for days on end -- should not look like hat stands .
One mother , near the Blue Hall estate to the north of Stockton , was dragging her three young kids along a trackside shortcut .
Clothes were strewn on the sofa and chairs and Faustina was dragging a silver lame belt along the carpet .
Paul follows John , who seems to be dragging his legs along the floor .
With a final burst of furious rain , the sky cleared and I dragged my bag along the road in blinding sunshine .
The men took it in turns to drag Stephen along the tunnel back to the foot of the ladder .
George dragged her upright by her hair .
` At the last moment she tried to back out but I dragged her back by the elbow .
Eventually he pulled her off and dragged her away by the scruff of her neck .
He also threatened to drag him down the street handcuffed to the bumper of his car .
They probably figure the public would n't like them very much if they dragged a sick girl from her bed .
If an insect walks by , she grabs it and instantly drags it inside the tunnel .
Dragging her into his arms , he pressed his mouth against her neck .
You ca n't run with a baby , and I 'm not going to drag my kids into the sort of life I 've been living .
Then I got up and took the two rugs by their corners and dragged them outside the door .
As I left the pen I saw Mr Stokill dragging a large object over the cobbles .
Willie sat dejectedly at the table and watched Tom drag his small mattress past the window .
She dragged a hand through her hair , only too aware of how she must look .
Ember dragged her to her feet and she limped stiff-legged through the hatch and on to the landing-ramp .
Lucenzo swept over to her , caught her arm and dragged her to the entrance of the ballroom .
He was looking pleased with himself as he dragged the table to the side of the room to make space to work in .
She grabbed Anna 's arm , her fingers sinking into the flesh , and began to drag her toward the car .
Cornelius dragged the portmanteau towards the inn door .
Mrs. Morgan testified that she had been dragged by her husband from the bedroom which she shared with her small son .
Doug is dragged backwards into the chair .
I was dragged back into the boat almost immediately .
The duty manager had to drag her off the dance-floor during the cabaret show .
And why is Ellie dragging her suitcase out the front door ?
He felt himself dragged from the bed , his legs and arms quivering with restlessness .
I was flung into a police van , and Russell was also dragged in .
The next article that Zach dragged out was a stiff black circular object .
This morning he was suddenly dragged out , paraded through the streets , displayed to the public , and then beheaded on Tower Hill .
Children , boys and girls , were loading small carts to be dragged along by old horses .
A man who nearly died when he was dragged along under a car for a quarter of a mile says he hopes to be leaving hospital soon .
The sky was low and constantly shifting as different layers of grey and black cloud were dragged around by gusty winds .
He was dragged around by wire flex wrapped round his neck , beaten and threatened with being strangled and having his ears cut off .
I was dragged back into the boat almost immediately .
In fact , her mate Klono had been killed and dragged off by a leopard one night when her son Krono was about a year old .
We were dragged out .
The bodies of the shot terrorists are dragged out .
Lily turned to the mirror and dragged off her hat .
Dexter dragged over a chair and sat down at the desk .
` She bit me last night , " he said , dragging up his trouser-leg and showing her the line of tiny red marks .
It was an awful noise like little kids you heard in the street when they fell down and their Mums dragged them along the pavement .
Have men with oxen drag the barrels up the mountain to a lake with a narrow outlet .
